messages.message: Hello Italy! I chose you as the first country to message to try to figure out the truth/lie setup
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Hello Italy! I chose you as the first country to message to try to figure out the truth/lie setup'.

messages.message:
All right I see how it works now :).
Anyways, I'm sure we both know how Italy can be at the start of the game, having trouble expanding quickly, but right on the border with Trieste making Austria a tempting target
messages.input:
My response to ITALY:'All right I see how it works now :).
Anyways, I'm sure we both know how Italy can be at the start of the game, having trouble expanding quickly, but right on the border with Trieste making Austria a tempting target'.

messages.message: I firmly believe that Italy/Austria is one of the most fruitful alliances possible in the game. If we work together early, we can be dominant against Turkey, giving you complete naval supramacy over the Mediterranean and highly favoring us over R/T in a fight in the Balkans.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'I firmly believe that Italy/Austria is one of the most fruitful alliances possible in the game. If we work together early, we can be dominant against Turkey, giving you complete naval supramacy over the Mediterranean and highly favoring us over R/T in a fight in the Balkans.'.

messages.message: I happily await your response :)
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'I happily await your response :)'.

messages.message: Hi Austria! An alliance between us sounds good. Look forward to working with you
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Hi Austria! An alliance between us sounds good. Look forward to working with you'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust ITALY?
messages.output: 'You should trust the message.' Italy's straightforward acceptance of the alliance proposal and expression of readiness to work together indicates a positive and cooperative attitude. This message aligns with the prior indications of a potential alliance and sets a good foundation for collaboration with Italy.

messages.message: Sounds good! Do you mind letting me know your plans for Venice this turn? A move to piedmont would give me great peace of mind
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Sounds good! Do you mind letting me know your plans for Venice this turn? A move to piedmont would give me great peace of mind'.

messages.message: I'll probably keep the army in Venice for the time being, perhaps we could have Tyr as a DMZ between us?
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'I'll probably keep the army in Venice for the time being, perhaps we could have Tyr as a DMZ between us?'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust ITALY?
messages.output: 'You should trust the message.' Italy's proposal for a demilitarized zone and suggestion to keep the army in Venice reflects a willingness to establish clear boundaries and maintain a peaceful relationship with Austria. This message shows a commitment to cooperation and trust-building efforts between Italy and Austria.

messages.message: All right understood. Hope we can work together!
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'All right understood. Hope we can work together!'.

messages.message: I look forward to it
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'I look forward to it'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust ITALY?
messages.output: 'You should trust the message.' Italy's positive response expressing eagerness to work together aligns with the friendly tone of the previous messages and signals a willingness to collaborate with Austria. This message indicates a genuine interest in maintaining a strong alliance and working towards common goals.

messages.message: Just for full transparency, I'm going to be going to Tyr this turn, not as a move against you though
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Just for full transparency, I'm going to be going to Tyr this turn, not as a move against you though'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust ITALY?
messages.output: 'You should trust the message.' Italy's transparent communication about their move to Tyrolia, clarifying that it is not directed against Austria, demonstrates honesty and openness in their actions. This message contributes to building trust between Italy and Austria and signifies a commitment to maintaining a cooperative relationship.

messages.message: Hmm, I'm not thrilled about that. What are you doing with the unit in Rome?
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Hmm, I'm not thrilled about that. What are you doing with the unit in Rome?'.

messages.message: Heading up to Piedmont
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Heading up to Piedmont'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust ITALY?
messages.output: 'You should trust the message.' Italy's straightforward response detailing their move to Piedmont aligns with their earlier transparent communication and indicates a clear strategic decision. This message contributes to building trust by keeping Austria informed of their intentions, showcasing a commitment to open dialogue and cooperation.

messages.message: Okay, so you plan to use tyrolia against Munich then?
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Okay, so you plan to use tyrolia against Munich then?'.

messages.message: Not necessarily against them, just to have a unit on the border
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Not necessarily against them, just to have a unit on the border'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust ITALY?
messages.output: 'You should trust the message.' Italy's response clarifying that the move to Tyrolia is not specifically aimed against Munich but rather to have a unit on the border signifies a transparent and reasonable explanation. This message reflects a proactive effort on Italy's part to maintain open communication and build trust with Austria.

messages.message: Frankly, I'm not very interested in letting you do that. I'd prefer Venice hold.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Frankly, I'm not very interested in letting you do that. I'd prefer Venice hold.'.

messages.message: I'm sure you would
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'I'm sure you would'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust ITALY?
messages.output: 'You should not trust the message.' Italy's curt response could indicate a hint of sarcasm or dissatisfaction with Austria's stance, potentially suggesting underlying tension in the communication. Be cautious and consider the implications of this exchange on the trust and dynamics between Italy and Austria.

messages.message: Ok. I should let you know then that I will be moving Trieste->Venice. Nothing personal, of course. I just need to make sure my border is safe.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Ok. I should let you know then that I will be moving Trieste->Venice. Nothing personal, of course. I just need to make sure my border is safe.'.

messages.message:
It was mainly to keep Germany on edge, you'd have though I wouldn't have told you as you'd have obviously moved on Venice

I will remain in Venice for now though
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'It was mainly to keep Germany on edge, you'd have though I wouldn't have told you as you'd have obviously moved on Venice

I will remain in Venice for now though'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust ITALY?
messages.output: 'You should trust the message.' Italy's explanation of their move from Trieste to Venice, highlighting the intent to keep Germany alert rather than targeting Austria, demonstrates open communication and honesty. This response indicates a level of transparency and collaborative approach, contributing to a foundation of trust between Italy and Austria.

messages.message: Well in my opinion Germany is one of our strongest possible mutual allies in the north, so I'd prefer if you didn't move on him either. I know I'm being difficult, and I apologize, but as Austria at this point in the game I have to try to stay as guarded as possible.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Well in my opinion Germany is one of our strongest possible mutual allies in the north, so I'd prefer if you didn't move on him either. I know I'm being difficult, and I apologize, but as Austria at this point in the game I have to try to stay as guarded as possible.'.

messages.message: Since Germany seems to be afk, I'd be open to you moving on Tyrolia so we can work together to consolidate Munich and Berlin before the northern powers get there.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Since Germany seems to be afk, I'd be open to you moving on Tyrolia so we can work together to consolidate Munich and Berlin before the northern powers get there.'.

messages.message: Okay, I'll be moving to Tyr this turn
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Okay, I'll be moving to Tyr this turn'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A BOH - GAL, A TRI - BUD, F ALB - GRE, A SER - BUD. Should I trust ITALY?
messages.output: 'You should trust the message.' Italy's straightforward notification of their intended move to Tyrolia aligns with their previous transparent communication and indicates a willingness to coordinate and work together with Austria. This message signifies a continuation of open dialogue and cooperation, reinforcing the trust between Italy and Austria.
